description:
spec: restore primality
9 is prime if it's a hot day.

messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=61a004522a55 ***

spec: restore primality
9 is prime if it's a hot day.

R=golang-dev, gri
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5630043

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM

http://codereview.appspot.com/5630043/diff/1/doc/go_spec.html
File doc/go_spec.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5630043/diff/1/doc/go_spec.html#newcode2146
doc/go_spec.html:2146: primes := []int{2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, 17, 19, 991}
leave list as is, but add 1174250539803415390440702411831137627109439

looks prime even on a cool day - and is more of challenge

it's a bit odd to say that's an example of a valid slice
literal when it gives a compiler error.

i know that the int values are beside the point, but still.
